projects.title: Explore My Work Through My Personal Projects Available on GitHub!

project1.title: Recipes API - A REST API to discover recipes
project1.description: The Recipes API is a REST API that provides access to a wide range of cooking recipes, cocktails, and complete menus. It exposes multiple endpoints that allow users to retrieve recipes based on various search criteria. The API leverages external services such as Edamam and CocktailDB to fetch the necessary data for generating recipes. Through this integration, users can search for dishes based on specific ingredients or culinary preferences. The application was developed using the Jersey framework, ensuring a modular, scalable, and maintainable architecture. To enhance code organization and extensibility, several design patterns have been implemented, including the Strategy Pattern and the Template Method Pattern. The API also offers maximum flexibility by allowing results to be retrieved in multiple formats, including JSON and XML, catering to developers' needs and different client applications. To facilitate integration and usage, a detailed Swagger documentation has been provided. The source code of the application is available on its GitHub repository, where you will also find a comprehensive README file explaining how to set up the environment, run the API, and test endpoints with different criteria.

project2.title: Restaurant Reservation & Review App
project2.description: This app allows users to discover restaurants retrieved directly from the Google Places API. They can make a reservation by providing multiple details such as date, name, and number of people, with input validation to ensure data consistency. Users can also view their reservations using a unique reference. Reservation and review management is securely handled via Firebase. Additionally, users can leave reviews with photos taken directly within the app, which can be edited with filters. Developed in Java, this project is available on GitHub, where you can view the source code and find more details.

project3.title: Word Guessing Game
project3.description: This is a word guessing game built with Vue.js, where players try to guess a 5-letter word within 6 attempts. The game includes a 10-minute timer and validates each word against an API to ensure it exists. Correct letters are highlighted in green, while misplaced letters (that are present in the word but in the wrong position) are highlighted in red. The word to be guessed is also logged in the console after each game. The app follows a component-based architecture using Vue.js, which ensures modularity and reusability of code. Additionally, Cypress UI tests have been implemented to ensure the app functions correctly. The source code is available on GitHub, where a detailed README explains how to set up and run the project. The app also includes a statistics page to track previous game results and performance. For more information, check the README on GitHub for instructions on running the project and viewing the stats page.

project4.title: Simplified Operating System
project4.description: ScratchOS is a minimalist operating system developped in C language and designed for educational purposes. The project simulates basic shell operations such as user management and file permission handling. While it does not yet support full file creation or removal functionalities, the system can easily be extended to include these features. This project was developed as part of a university course. The source code is available on GitHub, along with installation instructions to get the system up and running.

project5.title: Personal Portfolio

It includes several sections, such as one dedicated to my projects with detailed descriptions and links to demos or GitHub, an 'About Me' section to share my experience, and a contact section for visitors to easily reach out to me. If you would like to check out the source code and learn more details, it is available on GitHub.
